question.short: What is the origin of the SARS-CoV-2 virus?
question.long: What is the origin of the SARS-CoV-2 virus?

description: Results from studies trying to determine how the COVID-19 pandemic started.

no_consensus.description: The literature has not yet reached a consensus on the origin of the SARS-CoV-2 virus

animal_transmission.description: The literature suggests that the SARS-CoV-2 virus was transmitted from animals to humans

towards_animal_transmission.description: The literature suggests that the SARS-CoV-2 virus was probably transmitted from animals to humans, but more research is needed

towards_lab_leak.description: The literature suggests that the SARS-CoV-2 virus may have originated from a laboratory leak, but more research is needed

lab_leak.description: The literature suggests that the SARS-CoV-2 virus originated from a laboratory leak

animal_transmission.description: The results of the paper suggest that the SARS-CoV-2 virus was transmitted from animals to humans

animal_transmission_unlike_literature.description: The results of the paper suggest that the SARS-CoV-2 virus was probably transmitted from animals to humans, unlike what is reported in the literature

animal_transmission_but_low_confidence.description: The results of the paper suggest that the SARS-CoV-2 virus was probably transmitted from animals to humans, but the evidence is not strong

animal_transmission_but_mixed.description: The results of the paper suggest that the SARS-CoV-2 virus was probably transmitted from animals to humans, but the evidence is mixed

mixed.description: The results of the paper cannot determine the origin of the SARS-CoV-2 virus

no_results.description: There is not enough evidence to determine the origin of the SARS-CoV-2 virus

lab_leak_but_mixed.description: The results of the paper suggest that the SARS-CoV-2 virus may have originated from a laboratory leak, but the evidence is mixed

lab_leak_but_low_confidence.description: The results of the paper suggest that the SARS-CoV-2 virus may have originated from a laboratory leak, but the evidence is not strong

lab_leak_unlike_literature.description: The results of the paper suggest that the SARS-CoV-2 virus may have originated from a laboratory leak, unlike what is reported in the literature

lab_leak.description: The results of the paper suggest that the SARS-CoV-2 virus may have originated from a laboratory leak

papers.title: The origins of SARS-CoV-2: A critical review
papers.quote: As for the vast majority of human viruses, the most parsimonious explanation for the origin of SARS-CoV-2 is a zoonotic event

papers.title: Tracing the origins of SARS-COV-2 in coronavirus phylogenies: a review
papers.quote: on the basis of currently available data it is not possible to determine whether the emergence of SARS-CoV-2 is the result of a zoonosis from a wild viral strain or an accidental escape of experimental strains

papers.title: SARS-CoV-2 infection at the Huanan seafood market
papers.quote: If a cluster of patients located a few meters away from each other had been detected at the market in the early days of the pandemic, it would be natural to suggest an animal source hotspot and animal-to-human contamination at the market. However, the first detected patients are relatively far from each other

papers.title: The Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market in Wuhan was the early epicenter of the COVID-19 pandemic
papers.quote: Although there is insufficient evidence to define upstream events, and exact circumstances remain obscure, our analyses indicate that the emergence of SARS-CoV-2 occurred through the live wildlife trade in China and show that the Huanan market was the epicenter of the COVID-19 pandemic
